t: Sell generic products in the Amazon store - Sell on Amazon
s: April 23, 2025 - Generic products are products that don’t belong to any identifiable brand and are sometimes called “unbranded products.” A generic product doesn’t have a distinctive name or logo on the product or its packaging.

t: r/AmazonSeller on Reddit: Can you list a generic product with no branded packaging as a brand? If not, why do I see product with no brand on their packages being listed with brand names?

s: A product is only considered 'Generic' when it is listed under the 'Generic' brand specifically. The brand name 'Generic' at Amazon refers to unbranded products that do not belong to any identifiable brand. An unbranded product does not have a distinctive name or logo.
